channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: In a year of steep challenges, there were still shining moments in global health
item.description: The Trump administration's deep cuts in U.S. foreign health aid had a devastating impact. Yet there were achievements of note in spite of it all.

item.title: An escalation in Yemen threatens to reignite civil war and widen tensions in the Gulf
item.description: Saudi Arabia bombed Yemen's port city of Mukalla, targeting a shipment of weapons from the United Arab Emirates for separatist forces. The UAE later s...

item.title: Israel says it will bar aid groups, including Doctors Without Borders, from Gaza
item.description: Israel accused Doctors Without Borders, one of the largest health organizations operating in Gaza, of failing to clarify the roles of some staff that ...

item.title: What being around death taught this hospital chaplain about life
item.description: J.S. Park helps patients and their families cope with death every day as a hospital chaplain. He explains what to expect as a person is dying, and how...

item.title: Judge orders Trump administration to continue to seek funding for the CFPB
item.description: The order is the latest in a complex legal battle over the fate of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, a watchdog agency.

item.title: 9/24: CBS Morning News
item.description: Jimmy Kimmel returns to air after suspension; CBS News speaks with leading researcher about White House autism claims.

item.title: UAE says it will withdraw from Yemen after Saudi strike on separatist-held port
item.description: The UAE and Saudi have been allies in the war against the Houthis, but infighting between the rival factions they support has caused a rift between th...

item.title: 11/3: CBS Morning News
item.description: Government shutdown enters Day 34; Affordability and economy top concerns for voters ahead of Election Day.

item.title: The 'thorny' issues that threaten to derail a Russia-Ukraine peace deal
item.description: Two of the main sticking points involve territory and the fate of Europe's biggest nuclear plant, which is currently occupied by Russia.

item.title: Thieves use drill to steal €30m in German bank heist
item.description: Gelsenkirchen Police say thieves used the "quiet" days after Christmas to break into the high street branch.

item.title: 10/23: CBS Morning News
item.description: U.S. strikes two more alleged drug vessels in the Pacific; Texas teen to play drums in Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade.

item.title: U.S. sanctions 10 people and firms from Iran and Venezuela over drone and missile trade
item.description: The U.S. has imposed sanctions on 10 individuals and firms from Iran and Venezuela. These sanctions target Iran’s drone trade and ballistics program.

item.title: Tatiana Schlossberg, a granddaughter of the late President John F. Kennedy, has died at 35
10/24: CBS Morning News
item.description: Police fire at truck backing into them at protest in California; CBS News speaks with Colombia's president about U.S. strikes on alleged drug boats an...

item.title: Arctic blast brings snow and wind to the Great Lakes and Northeast
10/21: CBS Morning News
item.description: Vice President JD Vance arrives in Israel as Gaza ceasefire holds; NYC clinic offers blind teens a chance to play baseball.

item.title: Protests spread across Iran for third day after currency hits record low
item.description: The Iranian rial hit a record low against the US dollar on Sunday, prompting shopkeepers in Tehran to stage protests, which have quickly spread.

item.title: Eurostar warns of ongoing delays after services resume
item.description: Passengers detail how they have been left stranded and looking for other routes after power issues in the Channel Tunnel.
